ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] RE: Test Problem fixed
ygData.msgSnippet: Something that still amazes me is that you yanks have a choice, i have seen many threads on usenet saying.. are you going to vote? over here, come election
ygData.messageBody:
Something that still amazes me is that you yanks have a choice, i have seen
many threads on usenet saying.. "are you going to vote?" over here, come
election time, if you dont vote its a $100 fine or a stay at one of Her
Majesty's lovely hotels.

That said... we still tick a box with an X, i mean what the hell is a chad
anyway? :)

----- Original Message -----
From: <hho@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, November 13, 2000 6:14 PM
Subject: [eqbards] RE: Test Problem fixed


>
>
> >Message: 7
> > Date: Fri, 10 Nov 2000 14:41:31 -0800
> > From: John Tatsukawa <john@...>
> >Subject: RE: Test Problem fixed
> >
> >I mean if us American's can't figure out which darn holes to punch in a
> >ballot card (even a person with a doctorate was quoted as saying that it
> >was confusing) then how can we expect Verant to always get things right.
;-)
> >
>
> Mmh no comments, apart from that the ballot card looked pretty confusing
to me,
> luckely Im Danish we still cast our votes with a ball pen and an X.
>
> >Hmm, they are based in San Diego. Surfing programmers? Guards should be
> >responding to our hails with, "What's up dude? The waves are looking fine
> >my man!"
>
> Whats wrong with surfers!!!! well Windsurfers anyway!?!?
> >
> >I'm just glad that it was detected and fixed before it went live. I'd
give
> >them more credit had they found and detected the bug themselves, but then
> >again, we never hear about those.
> >
> >---Windleaf
